lines.text:
[rolls by Rabbit on a monocycle, dressed in a costume which is supposed to resemble Rabbit]
Trick or treat!
Not now, Gopher... And why are you dressed like a muskrat?
Muskrat?
[rolls away]
That guy can't tell a rabbit from a hole in the
[falls into his own hole]
grooooooooound!

[seeing Gopher dressed in an Eeyore-like costume]
Nice costume. You make a good yak.
I'm not supposed to be some yakidy-yakidy-yak!
A stormin' good storm! This is going to be the bestest Halloween ever, with loads of lightnin'! And thunderous thunderin'! And windiferous winds breaking everywhere! Hoo-hoo-hoo!

[after some of his pumpkins have been destroyed]
Oh my! My poor pumpkins! Are you alright, Pauline? Speak to me, Pietro! Don't you know me, Petunia?

[hiding under his chair]
Perhaps if you said something only you would say, I'd know you're you.

[standing outside the door]
A very good idea, Piglet. What should I say?
Well, possibly... "I am Pooh."
You are? Well then who am I?
But Piglet, Halloween without you would be like... It would be like...
Like last year. And the year before last year.
And the year before that year.
And all the years leading up to and including every last Halloween ever!
Trick or treat... or not.

[seeing that Piglet is not at home]
Don't you know what this means? He's been "pig-napped" by spookables!
I do so hope this blusterous and rather stormish night will not be too frightening for poor Piglet. I suspect something should be done.
[looking at the mirror]
But what? I don't know either. Think-think-think. Why, just because Piglet can't have Halloween with us, there's no reason we can't have Hallo-wasn't with him! I like the way you think!

[mocking Piglet]
"No way no how am I going to miss out on another Halloween! I'll have my own Hallo-wasn't all by myself." Hoo-hoo! If only Piglet was more like me and less like him!
Trick or treat - again.
